tweets.text: This is in part a result of all the hard work in recent years to create good habitat in the river Wye corridor with @Chilternstreams thanks to multiple funders inc @thameswater @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencySE hereâ€™s hoping we can do more in the coming monthsðŸ¤ž https://t.co/qFUK8E2HkP

Our Field Team have been out and about in North Lancashire doing maintenance activities at Wade Brook #Leyland 

They have been busy opening water course channels by doing tree work, cutting vegetation back and taking out big blockages to reduce the threat of #flood risk. https://t.co/QRjOwwI9Qo

@MariaHerlihyEA @EnvAgencySE @MoretonBack1 @SteveMooreEA @johncurtinEA @wifo_ea Hello Maria,  There is no 'boating season' - boaters pay for a 12 month registration.  Flow and maintenance take their toll but need to be minimised.
Great work by all involved  ,getting prepared for the new boating season #TeamEA .@EnvAgencySE @MoretonBack1 @SteveMooreEA @johncurtinEA @wifo_ea https://t.co/6T3vO7oZyL

Climate change, population growth and drought all put pressure on #water supplies ðŸ’§

We're launching a consultation on our updated map of the areas of the country where this pressure could be greatest.

Help us safeguard our future water supplies: https://t.co/QiNHGViNau https://t.co/QVOR9eKIlC

Meet Bill, a proud operator of one of the biggest mobile pumps in the country. This serious kit can shift an Olympic pool of floodwater in 25 mins! A vital part of our national stock that we deploy around the country wherever itâ€™s needed #floodaware #winterready https://t.co/q0xtgPXm3v

urls.title: Omnishambles - Mark Avery
urls.description: Have you ever had a colleague at work who promises everything but consistently delivers work which is of poor quality and usually arrives late too? Theyâ€™ re the worst arenâ€™ t they? They may be well-meaning, they may be the life and soul of the party and great fun socially but they are a total waste of space as far as the work environment is concerned. Over-promising and under-delivering work colleagues tend not to stay around for long. DEFRA reminds me of those colleagues. The problem is that we are
